channel.title: AP News - US News
channel.description: Top US News stories from AP News

item.title: Gubernatorial candidate Mark Robinson treated for burns received at appearance, campaign says
item.description: North Carolina Republican Lt. Gov. Mark Robinson received burns during a campaign appearance in his bid for governor, but his campaign says he is in good spirits and will continue on the campaign trail.

item.title: Jimmy Carter at 100: A century of changes for a president, the US and the world since 1924
item.description: Already the longest-lived of the 45 men to serve as U.S. president, Jimmy Carter is about to reach the century mark.

item.title: Vance exuded calm during a tense debate stage moment. Can he keep it up when he faces Walz?
item.description: Republican vice presidential nominee JD Vance has a reputation for being informed, articulate and all but unflappable.
